subject: Climate & Environment
title: Carbon Monoxide: The Silent Killer
description: A quick, practical guide to Carbon Monoxide: The Silent Killer.

hook.text: Carbon monoxide has no color, no smell, and no taste. That is what makes it lethal.

buildup.text: It comes from incomplete combustion â€” car engines, gas stoves, wood fires, and generators.

discovery.text: CO binds to hemoglobin 200 times more strongly than oxygen, starving cells of what they need.

twist.text: Low-level exposure causes headaches and confusion. Victims often don't realize the danger.

climax.text: In cities, rush-hour CO levels spike near busy intersections and inside parking garages.

punchline.text: The most dangerous gas is the one you can't detect without a machine.

quiz.question: Why is carbon monoxide so dangerous?
options: It binds to blood cells more strongly than oxygen
